thig12.1:1.1: “I’m a water-carrier. Even when it’s cold,
thig12.1:1.2: I must always plunge into the water;
thig12.1:1.3: I fear I’ll get the stick from noble ladies,
thig12.1:1.4: harassed by fear of abuse and anger.
thig12.1:2.1: Brahmin, what are you afraid of,
thig12.1:2.2: that you always plunge into the water,
thig12.1:3.2: Madam Puṇṇikā, when you ask me:
thig12.1:3.4: to ward off the wickedness I have done.
thig12.1:4.3: by ablution in water they are
thig12.1:5.3: ‘Actually, by ablution in water one is
thig12.1:6.1: Would not they all go to heaven, then:
thig12.1:6.2: all the frogs and the turtles,
thig12.1:7.5: by ablution in water they too would be
thig12.1:8.2: the bad deeds of the past,
thig12.1:8.3: then they’d also wash off goodness,
thig12.1:8.4: and thereby you would be excluded.
thig12.1:9.1: Brahmin, the thing that you are afraid of,
thig12.1:9.2: when you always plunge into the water,
thig12.1:9.3: do not do that very thing,
thig12.1:9.4: don’t let the cold harm your skin.”
thig12.1:10.1: “I have been on the wrong path,
thig12.1:10.2: and you’ve guided me to the noble path.
thig12.1:12.3: If you should do a bad deed,
thig12.1:13.1: you won’t be freed from suffering,
thig12.1:13.2: though you fly away and flee.
thig12.1:14.1: go for refuge to the Buddha, the poised,
thig12.1:14.2: to his teaching and to the Sangha.
thig12.1:14.4: that will be good for you.”
thig12.1:15.1: “I go for refuge to the Buddha, the poised,
thig12.1:15.2: to his teaching and to the Sangha.
thig12.1:15.4: that will be good for me.
thig12.1:16.1: In the past I was related to Brahmā,
thig12.1:16.2: today I truly am a brahmin!
thig12.1:16.3: I am master of the three knowledges, accomplished in wisdom,
thig12.1:16.4: I’m a scholar and a bathed initiate.”
thig12.1:18.1: The Book of the Sixteens is finished.
